name: AzureFileCopy
description: Copy files to azure blob or vm(s)
helpMarkDown: Copy files to azure blob or vm(s)
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: ConnectedServiceName
inputs.label: Azure Subscription
inputs.helpMarkDown: Azure subscription is needed for accessing the storage account.

inputs.name: SourcePath
inputs.label: Source
inputs.helpMarkDown: Absolute path of the source folder or file on the local machine, or a UNC Share.

inputs.name: StorageAccount
inputs.label: Storage Account
inputs.helpMarkDown: A pre-existing storage account is required. Storage account is also used as an intermediary for copying to Azure VMs

inputs.name: Destination
inputs.label: Destination
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the destination either Azure Blob or VMs.

inputs.name: ContainerName
inputs.label: ContainerName
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a pre-existing container or else a new one will be created automatically.

inputs.name: BlobPrefix
inputs.label: Blob Prefix
inputs.helpMarkDown: Useful while downloading, as it acts as a filter. Example - you can apppend your build number to all your blobs.

inputs.name: EnvironmentName
inputs.label: Target Machine Group
inputs.helpMarkDown: Name of the target Machine Group for copying the files to.​

inputs.name: MachineNames
inputs.label: Copy to Machines
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a comma separated list of machines like Machine1, Machine2. Default is all machines in the Machine Group.

inputs.name: TargetPath
inputs.label: Destination Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Local Path on the target machines for copying the files from the source. Environment variable can be used. For example, $env:windir\BudgetIT\Web.

inputs.name: CleanTargetBeforeCopy
inputs.label: Clean Target
inputs.helpMarkDown: Setting it to true will clean up the destination folder before copying the files.

inputs.name: CopyFilesInParallel
inputs.label: Copy Files In Parallel
inputs.helpMarkDown: Setting it to true will copy files in parallel to the target machines.
